meanings.definition: To split or crack, especially due to heat or pressure.
meanings.sent1: The old tree trunk began to spald under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to spald the delicate glass by placing it on a hot surface.
meanings.sent3: The chocolate bar started to spald in the pocket of his pants.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was so high that it felt like it could spald at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The ice cream started to spald as soon as it touched the warm pavement.

meanings.definition: A piece of wood that has split or cracked.
meanings.sent1: He picked up the spald from the forest floor to use as firewood.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter discarded the spald as it was too damaged to be used in the project.
meanings.sent3: The spald made a creaking sound as it was stepped on.
meanings.sent4: The spald lay abandoned in the corner of the workshop, forgotten and worn.
meanings.sent5: The spald was so brittle that it crumbled at the slightest touch.

meanings.definition: A type of leather used for making gloves.
meanings.sent1: She carefully selected the spald for her new pair of gloves.
meanings.sent2: The artisan crafted the gloves from the finest spald available.
meanings.sent3: The spald had a unique texture that made the gloves stand out.
meanings.sent4: The spald gloves were soft to the touch, a delight to wear.
meanings.sent5: The spald gloves gleamed in the sunlight, showcasing their quality.
